page.title: 04 CANALS OF WEEDON BEC
page.content: The {Grand Union Canal} was opened as far as Weedon in 1796 as the {Grand Junction Canal}.However Blisworth tunnel was not completed until March 1805. The canal enters Weedon near "The Narrowboat" public house on {Watling Street}.It goes under bridges 26 and 25 and then crosses Church Street,the {River Nene} and Bridge Street on aqueducts. Part of the canal used to go into the {Royal Military Depot} and was used to deliver men and materials.Boats had to navigate a lifting bridge on the {London & Birmingham Railway}. The canal leaves Weedon soon after bridge 23. There are two pleasure boatyards in Weedon,Concoform Marine and Waterways Holidays.
